body_html: Reading through the patch, I'm actually flip-flopping about Storage::capacity being a good name (I do feel like at some point we decided that capacity would be a good name on Storage). Basically, it's not obvious from the name that it's in bytes: it could very well be capacity in numels. capacity_nbytes or capacity_bytes has the unit of measure in its name, and feels clearer to me.

body: Reading through the patch, I'm actually flip-flopping about `Storage::capacity` being a good name (I do feel like at some point we decided that capacity would be a good name on Storage). Basically, it's not obvious from the name that it's in bytes: it could very well be capacity in numels. `capacity_nbytes` or `capacity_bytes` has the unit of measure in its name, and feels clearer to me.
